items.title: U.S. Banks Hoard Cash Amid Slow Loan Growth In Q1
items.description: Bigger US bank balance sheets did not translate to strong loan growth in the first quarter as the industry took a cautious approach to deploying fresh assets.

items.title: Billionaire CEO Jamie Dimon Says a Recession Isn't "Off the Table at This Point," Despite Lowering Tariffs. 5 Ways to Help Protect Your Stock Portfolio in Any Market Environment.
items.author: The Motley Fool
items.description: Despite the recent U.S.-China trade deal, JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon remains cautious about the economy, warning that a recession is still possible. The article provides five strategies to help protect your stock portfolio in any market environment.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: The article cites JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon's cautious outlook on the economy, noting that he believes a recession is still a possibility despite the recent trade deal.

The article uses Amazon as an example of a well-established company that has proven its ability to handle challenges and adapt its strategies, making it a good candidate for investment during uncertain times.
The article mentions Coca-Cola as one of the Dividend Kings, companies that have increased their dividend payments for at least the past 50 years, suggesting they are reliable dividend stocks.
The article also lists Johnson & Johnson as one of the Dividend Kings, indicating it is a reliable dividend-paying company.
The article recommends investing in an ETF that tracks one of the major market indexes, such as the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF, as a way to benefit from the long-term growth of the stock market as a whole.
